column4: hello, sorry for bother, maybe this is a kubuntu *only* problem, so sorry again. Im using kubuntu and after a fresh install i update everything with adept but it fails with libc6-i686 and fails and fails
what's the error it's giving when it fails
I'm not sure what this error is.  You're running apt-get as root, yes?
yes... but in fact, i dont want to run apt-get.. i just want to click update on adept
im a gentoo user, i installed ubuntu just to forget about dependency, distro or updates problems...
well, adept is just a front end, it's still running the same command sin reality
this kind of problems are normal in ubuntu?
not at all, or I'd probably be able to help you more lol
i can normally install ubuntu, update the system, install ATI drivers, and get everything running about as easily as I can in Windows XP Pro.
i only install kubuntu *normal install, then run adept to update everything.. and thats it, an error with libc6-i686
hmm.  It seems like a really random issue.  I don't use kde though, so I'm not up on adept issues (if this is an adept issue, which it probably isn't)
I'm not expert in general, so someone else could probably help you better
dont know... i dont know what to do to fix this broken status
You're in a pretty early stage, if it was me I'd just reinstall.
